meanings.definition: To wear out or exhaust through use or constant friction.
meanings.sent1: Playing soccer all day is outwearing.
meanings.sent2: The old shoes are outwearing quickly.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner was outwearing the pavement.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was outwearing like a threadbare sweater.
meanings.sent5: The constant stress was slowly outwearing her resolve.

meanings.definition: To surpass in wearing or endurance.
meanings.sent1: His determination is outwearing all obstacles.
meanings.sent2: The mountain climbers are outwearing the harsh conditions.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise outwearing the hare was a surprising sight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile outwearing the passing storms.
meanings.sent5: Their friendship outwearing the test of time.

meanings.definition: To tire out or exhaust through prolonged use or activity.
meanings.sent1: The long hike is outwearing the group.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive tasks are outwearing the employees.
meanings.sent3: The energetic puppy is outwearing its owner.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending meetings are outwearing my patience.
meanings.sent5: The constant noise is outwearing my concentration.
